item.title: Michelle add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "We work in the dark - we do what we can - we give what we have. Our doubt is our passion, and our passion is our task. The rest is the madness of art." -- Henry James

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Baird
item.description: "Never give consideration to things you do not want to happen." -- David Baird

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "One of the new things people began to find out in the last century was that thoughts- just mere thoughts- are as powerful as electric batteries- as good for one as sunlight is, or as bad for one as poison. To let a sad thought or a bad one get into your mind is as dangerous as letting a scarlet fever germ get into your body. If you let it stay there after it has got you in you may never get over it as long as you live." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jean Piaget
item.description: "Play is the answer to how anything new comes about." -- Jean Piaget

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Let the beauty of what you love be what you do." -- Rumi

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Life does not consist mainly, or even largely, of facts or happenings. It consist mainly of the storm of thoughts that is forever flowing through one's head." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "Think before you speak. Read before you think." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot
